page.title: 15FARM HOSKINS
page.content: Peggy Deards and Henry Fish both own Hoskins Farm Riding School.They have both lived there for twenty four years.The farm house is five hundred years old in parts.They own twelve acres of land.Before Peggy and Henry came it was just a farm.When they came they had no water or electricity.They have twenty horses and one donkey.The horses eat pony nuts,hay and grass.It costs #10-#15 for one horse to be fed a week.It costs #14 for a full set of shoes to put on a horse.For a one hour lesson it costs #3.50 for under sixteens to ride.They have an average of seventy people riding a week.These are some of the breeds of horses they have Shetland,Newforest,Welsh,Exmoor and mixed breeds.These are the other animals they have on the farm six dogs,three cats,two kittens,three geese and two cockerels.
